title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Bluefin Tuna)
text_raw:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Sea-Fisheries (Bluefin Tuna) 

Regulations 2024.
text_norm: 1 regulation may cited sea-fisheries (bluefin tuna) regulation 2024

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 2. These Regulations do not apply to a person onboard a fishing vessel that
text_raw:
2. These Regulations do not apply to a person onboard a fishing vessel that 

is– 

(a) 

(b) 

(c) 

licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries 
(Amendment) Act 2003, 

entered in the Register of Fishing Boats maintained under section 
74 of the Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006, or 
required by regulations under section 76 of that Act to be so 
entered, and 

registered under the Merchant Shipping (Registry, Lettering and 
Numbering of Fishing Boats) Regulations 2005 (S.I. No. 261 of 
2005).

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: In these Regulations:
text_raw:
3. 

In these Regulations: 

“bluefin tuna” means Thunnus thynnus; 

“section 14 authorisation” means an authorisation issued by the Minister for 
Environment, Climate and Communications under section 14 (as substituted by 
section 4 of the Fisheries (Amendment) Act 1962) of the Fisheries 
(Consolidation) Act 1959, permitting such person, as the vessel operator of a 
specific vessel identified in the authorisation, to target bluefin tuna in a catch, 
tag and release fishery.
text_norm: 3 regulation bluefin tuna mean thunnus thynnus section 14 authorisation mean authorisation issued minister environment climate communication section 14 (as substituted section 4 fishery (amendment) act 1962) fishery (consolidation) act 1959 permitting person vessel operator specific vessel identified authorisation target bluefin tuna catch tag release fishery

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 4. A person shall not target, retain on board, tranship, transfer, tow, land,
text_raw:
4. A person shall not target, retain on board, tranship, transfer, tow, land, 

transport, store, offer for sale or sell bluefin tuna.
text_norm: 4 person shall target retain board tranship transfer tow land transport store offer sale sell bluefin tuna

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 5. The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall not remove from the sea a
text_raw:
5. The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall not remove from the sea a 

bluefin tuna caught alive but, if so removed, the bluefin tuna shall be– 

(a) 

carefully handled and returned immediately alive to the waters 
from which it was taken, and 

(b) 

recorded, and reported, in accordance with Regulation 7. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 19th July, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [352] 3
text_norm: 5 holder section 14 authorisation shall remove sea bluefin tuna caught alive removed bluefin tuna shall be- (a) carefully handled returned immediately alive water taken (b) recorded reported accordance regulation 7 notice making statutory instrument published iris oifigiuil 19th july 2024 352 3

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 6. The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall, in respect of a bluefin tuna
text_raw:
6. The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall, in respect of a bluefin tuna 

that dies during capture– 

(a) 

return the bluefin tuna immediately to the waters from which it 
was taken, and 

(b) 

record and report the event in accordance with Regulation 7.
text_norm: 6 holder section 14 authorisation shall respect bluefin tuna dy capture- (a) return bluefin tuna immediately water taken (b) record report event accordance regulation 7

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 7. (1) The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall, if engaged in the
text_raw:
7. (1) The holder of a section 14 authorisation shall, if engaged in the 

catching, tagging and releasing of bluefin tuna: 

(a) 

on or before return to port, record bluefin tuna caught, and/or 
tagged and released and/or any bluefin tuna that died on that trip 
in the fish data collection form, and record such data 
electronically on a system identified by the Sea-Fisheries 
Protection Authority, as published on its website, and, 

(b) no later than 24 hours after the return to port, report, by means of 
a completed survey trip and quantitative data report, any bluefin 
tuna that were successfully caught and/or tagged and released or 
any bluefin tuna that died, or were removed, in accordance with 
Regulation 5, on that trip to a body established under statute, 
identified by the Sea-Fisheries Protection Authority, as published 
on its website. 

(2) The form of the completed survey trip and quantitative data report 
referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall be specified on the website of the SeaFisheries Protection Authority and information required in such a report shall 
include information on fishing time, effort (number of persons engaged in 
fishing), fish playing time, misses, and any bluefin tuna that is caught and/or 
tagged and released.
text_norm: 7 (1) holder section 14 authorisation shall engaged catching tagging releasing bluefin tuna (a) return port record bluefin tuna caught tagged released bluefin tuna died trip fish data collection form record data electronically system identified sea-fisheries protection authority published website (b) later 24 hour return port report mean completed survey trip quantitative data report bluefin tuna successfully caught tagged released bluefin tuna died removed accordance regulation 5 trip body established statute identified sea-fisheries protection authority published website (2) form completed survey trip quantitative data report referred paragraph (1)(b) shall specified website seafisheries protection authority information required report shall include information fishing time effort (number person engaged fishing) fish playing time miss bluefin tuna caught tagged released

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 8. A record and report made by the holder of a section 14 authorisation in
text_raw:
8. A record and report made by the holder of a section 14 authorisation in 

accordance with Regulation 7 shall include the following particulars: 

(i) 

the name of the vessel; 

(ii) 

(iii) 

the name of the vessel operator responsible for the catch 
and/or tag and release of the bluefin tuna; 

 the length of the largest bluefin tuna caught in centimetres, 
or where only one bluefin tuna is caught, the length of that 
bluefin tuna; 

(iv) all bluefin tuna catches and/or tagged and released, alive or 

dead, in numbers; 

(v) 

tag identification details of each bluefin tuna caught and, 
where a previously tagged bluefin tuna is caught during 
fishing, the existing tag identification details of such fish.
text_norm: 8 record report made holder section 14 authorisation accordance regulation 7 shall include following particular (i) name vessel (ii) (iii) name vessel operator responsible catch tag release bluefin tuna length largest bluefin tuna caught centimetre one bluefin tuna caught length bluefin tuna (iv) bluefin tuna catch tagged released alive dead number (v) tag identification detail bluefin tuna caught previously tagged bluefin tuna caught fishing existing tag identification detail fish

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 9. Where the holder of a section 14 authorisation targets bluefin tuna by
text_raw:
9. Where the holder of a section 14 authorisation targets bluefin tuna by 
means of a vessel, the operator and owner of the vessel shall ensure that a fully 

 
 
 
 
 4 [352] 

functioning vessel monitoring system is installed and operational at all times on 
the vessel and is capable of transmitting, in a manner, and to a destination, as 
may be specified by the Sea-Fisheries Protection Authority, live data on the date 
and time, and on the speed, heading and position of the vessel.
text_norm: 9 holder section 14 authorisation target bluefin tuna mean vessel operator owner vessel shall ensure fully 4 352 functioning vessel monitoring system installed operational time vessel capable transmitting manner destination may specified sea-fisheries protection authority live data date time speed heading position vessel

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 10. For the purposes of Regulation 9, a “vessel monitoring system” shall
text_raw:
10. For the purposes of Regulation 9, a “vessel monitoring system” shall 
mean a satellite-tracking device that transmits live data on the date and time, and 
fishing vessel’s identification, geographical position, course and speed.
text_norm: 10 purpose regulation 9 vessel monitoring system shall mean satellite-tracking device transmits live data date time fishing vessel identification geographical position course speed

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: 11. The Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction (Bluefin Tuna) Regulations
text_raw:
11. The Sea-Fisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction (Bluefin Tuna) Regulations 

2019 (S.I. No. 265 of 2019) are revoked. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

26 June, 2024. 

CHARLIE MCCONALOGUE, 

Minister for Agriculture, Food and the Marine. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [352] 5
text_norm: 11 sea-fisheries maritime jurisdiction (bluefin tuna) regulation 2019 (s.i no 265 2019) revoked given official seal 26 june 2024 charlie mcconalogue minister agriculture food marine 352 5

title: licensed under section 4 (as inserted by section 97 of the SeaFisheries and Maritime Jurisdiction Act 2006) of the Fisheries
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations provide that any person not authorised to target bluefin tuna 
in a catch, tag and release fishery shall not target, retain on board, tranship, 
transfer, tow, land, transport, store, offer for sale or sell bluefin tuna. 

These Regulations provide that any bluefin tuna caught alive in a bluefin tuna 
catch, tag and release fishery shall not be removed from the sea but, if so 
removed, the bluefin tuna shall be carefully handled and returned immediately 
alive to the waters from which it was taken, and recorded, and reported. 

These Regulations provide that for any bluefin tuna that dies during capture in a 
bluefin tuna catch, tag and release fishery, the bluefin tuna shall be returned 
immediately to the waters from which it was taken, and the event recorded and 
reported. 

These Regulations also provide that a fully functioning vessel monitoring system 
shall be installed and operational at all times on the vessel that is used to target 
bluefin tuna in a catch, tag and release fishery and that the vessel monitoring 
system is capable of transmitting, in a manner, and to a destination, as may be 
specified by the Sea-Fisheries Protection Authority, live data on the date and 
time, and on the speed, heading and position of the vessel. 

 
 
 
 
 
 6 [352]
